# [About]{.text-black} [The Kerala Agrobiodiversity Conference]{.text-green} {#about}

The Kerala Agrobiodiversity Conference -2025 (KAbCon-2025), an international Conference on Community Agrobiodiversity Management: in Kerala invites researchers, policymakers, farmers, indigenous leaders, development professionals, and sustainability advocates from around the world is action to engage in a collaborative dialogue on the integration of traditional wisdom, materials and modern science, innovations and technologies for climate-resilient food systems in biodiversity hotspots.

Jointly organized by the Kerala State Biodiversity Board (KSBB) and Kerala Agricultural University, College of Agriculture, Vellayani, the conference forms part of the 70th anniversary celebrations of the College of Agriculture and KSBB’s 20-year experience and lessons in biodiversity conservation and sustainable development. This landmark event will also commemorate the 80th anniversary of the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) and World Food Day 2025, as well as the Centenary Year of Prof. M. S. Swaminathan, the visionary behind India’s Green Revolution.

The conference is to contribute directly to key international frameworks and targets including the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals - SDG 2: Zero Hunger, SDG 13: Climate Action, and SDG 15: Life on Land - and the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework (KMGBF), particularly Targets 4 (Genetic diversity), 8 (Climate Resilience), and 10 (Sustainable Agriculture).

## [The]{.text-black} [Conference Objectives]{.text-green} {#objectives}

:::::: objectives-container
::: objective-box
**Promote Knowledge Exchange**  
Promote knowledge exchange (both traditional and modern) in agrobiodiversity conservation and mainstreaming, focusing on alternate seed systems, regenerative agriculture, and food production practices.
:::

::: objective-box
**Showcase Farmer Innovations**  
Showcase innovations of the custodian farmers of Kerala in crop genetic diversity conservation, enhancement, and sustainable management that strengthen climate adaptation, resilience, and food and nutrition security.
:::

::: objective-box
**Empower Local Institutions**  
Empower local governance institutions and community biodiversity management groups to localise global efforts aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework (KMG).
:::
::::::

## Key Themes {#themes}

• Agrobiodiversity Conservation and Community Seed Systems • Agroecological Transitions and Soil Health • Climate Resilience and Ecosystem Restoration in Agriculture • Governance, Policy, and Indigenous Knowledge Systems • Equity, Youth, and Inclusion in Agrobiodiversity
